StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: GWAS in Fibrosing Interstitial Lung Disease

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO DENVERFEDERATION OF AMER SOC FOR EXPER BIOLOGYNATIONAL JEWISH HEALTHVA EASTERN COLORADO HEALTH CARE SYSTEMDUKE UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The study that generated the genotype data was supported by the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (R01-HL095393, R01-HL097163, P01-HL092870, RC2-HL101715, U01-HL089897, U01-HL089856, U01-HL108642, and P50-HL0894932), the Veterans Administration (1I01BX001534), the Dorothy P. and Richard P. Simmons Center, and InterMune, Inc. Findings based on these genotype data are reported in “Genome-wide association study identifies multiple susceptibility loci for pulmonary fibrosis” Nature Genetics 45:613-620
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Data is limited to use for lung disease research only. Full or expedited IRB approval is required.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Lung Disease, IRB, PUB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-LD-IRB-PUB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Lung Disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.
Data is limited to use for lung disease research only. Full or expedited IRB approval is required.
